intro: Cyrtandra kealiae, commonly known as the Kālia or Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. Cyrtandra kealiae is a perennial shrub that can grow up to several feet tall, with lance-shaped leaves and a compact, bushy growth habit. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat and is considered a species of conservation concern due to habitat loss and invasive species.
